avalancheActivity.comment: Small wet avalanches might release in the continuing warm weather On January 3rd, the snowplow in Bláfjöll pushed a cornice which triggered a small slab avalance.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow subsided and melted in all elevations, in warm weather on Sunday, January 7th. Continuing warm weather is forecasted with some rain. Large avalanches are unlikely but small wet sluffs might release.

snowpackStructure.highlights: It warmed up significantly in all elevations on Sunday and then, snow subsided and melted. Before, wind slabs were in westerly aspects in mountains. Now, large avalanches are considered unlikely. Small wet avalanches might release in the continuing warm weather the next days, even though it is less likely than right after it warmed up.

travelAdvisory.comment: It has snowed in easterly winds last weeks in the North and East of the country and there is considerable amount of snow in the mountains. Instability in the snowpack will increase in a thawing weather that starts on Sunday and lasts into the week. Snow will likely melt a lot in the southern and western sides of the country. A weakness was discovered in the snowpack in the North at around 1000 m elevation in SE aspects. Very weak layering was also discovered at a shallow depth in wind slabs in the Eastfjords.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Instability in the snowpack will increase in a thawing weather that starts on Sunday and lasts into the week. Considerable snow is in mountains that will melt and loose cohesion temporarily.

weatherForecast.highlights: Allhvöss SA-átt og hlýtt næstu daga. Lítilsháttar væta en rigning á fimmtudag. Dregur úr vindi og snýst í V-átt seinnipart fimmtudags.

avalancheActivity.comment: A few wet avalanches released in Kirkjubólshlíð in Skutulsfjörður on January 2nd.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow subsided and melted in all elevations, in warm weather on Sunday, January 7th. Continuing warm weather is forecasted with some rain. Large avalanches are unlikely but small wet sluffs might release.

snowpackStructure.highlights: It warmed up significantly in all elevations on Sunday and then, snow subsided and melted. Before, there was dry snow in mountains with some layering. Now, large avalanches are considered unlikely. Small wet avalanches might release in the continuing warm weather the next days, even though it is less likely than right after it warmed up. The warm weather and rain could lead to small slush avalanches and rockfall.

travelAdvisory.comment: It has snowed in easterly winds last weeks in the North and East of the country and there is considerable amount of snow in the mountains. Instability in the snowpack will increase in a thawing weather that starts on Sunday and lasts into the week. Snow will likely melt a lot in the southern and western sides of the country. A weakness was discovered in the snowpack in the North at around 1000 m elevation in SE aspects. Very weak layering was also discovered at a shallow depth in wind slabs in the Eastfjords.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Instability in the snowpack will increase in a thawing weather that starts on Sunday and lasts into the week. Considerable snow is in mountains that will melt and loose cohesion temporarily.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hvassar suðlægar áttir og hlýtt næstu daga. Frostlaust til fjalla. Einhver rigning á þriðjudag og fimmtudag en úrkomulítið á miðvikudag.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Quite alot of snow in the mountains which is settling in the mild weather. Snowsensors are showing signs of isothermal snow quite deep down

travelAdvisory.comment: It has snowed in easterly winds last weeks in the North and East of the country and there is considerable amount of snow in the mountains. Instability in the snowpack will increase in a thawing weather that starts on Sunday and lasts into the week. Snow will likely melt a lot in the southern and western sides of the country. A weakness was discovered in the snowpack in the North at around 1000 m elevation in SE aspects. Very weak layering was also discovered at a shallow depth in wind slabs in the Eastfjords.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Instability in the snowpack will increase in a thawing weather that starts on Sunday and lasts into the week. Considerable snow is in mountains that will melt and loose cohesion temporarily.

weatherForecast.highlights: Suðlæg átt og fremur hlýtt. Gæti hvesst með hækkandi hitastigi á fimmtud.

avalancheActivity.comment: A few dry slab avalanches released in SW aspects in Eskifjörður and Fagridalur the night before January 5th. Wet avalanches released many places in the forecasting area in the thaw January 1st and 2nd.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow has subsided in warm weather and partly melted away. Wet avalanches might release in the continuing warm weather, especially high in mountains where the thaw did not reach on January 1st and 2nd.

snowpackStructure.highlights: It got warm up to mountain tops on Sunday and Monday and then, snow subsided and partly melted. No real avalanches have been reported in this thaw, but sluffs have released, and snowballs rolled in steep terrain. While it is still warm, wet avalanches might though release. Above 6-700 m, where the thaw did not reach on January 1st and 2nd, there is more snow and a possibility for a deeper weakness. At these high elevations, larger avalanches might release.

travelAdvisory.comment: It has snowed in easterly winds last weeks in the North and East of the country and there is considerable amount of snow in the mountains. Instability in the snowpack will increase in a thawing weather that starts on Sunday and lasts into the week. Snow will likely melt a lot in the southern and western sides of the country. A weakness was discovered in the snowpack in the North at around 1000 m elevation in SE aspects. Very weak layering was also discovered at a shallow depth in wind slabs in the Eastfjords.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Instability in the snowpack will increase in a thawing weather that starts on Sunday and lasts into the week. Considerable snow is in mountains that will melt and loose cohesion temporarily.

weatherForecast.highlights: Úrkomulaust næstu daga. Suðlægar áttir og hiti yfir frostmarki töluvert upp í fjöll á þriðjudag. Kólnar heldur á miðvikudag.
